page.title: 05ECOLOGY (COUNTRY PARK TWO)
page.content: One full time warden employed by Newbury District Council and three other wardens keep public order and prevent fires in summer and carry out general maintenance in winter. The majority of people who use Snelsmore common are the people walking dogs,families picnicking and school parties.There are grassy areas with benches and tables to encourage people to stay near the car parks and leave the rest of the common for walkers and wildlife enthusiasts.Some branches are snapped off trees but very little damage occures.Riding schools are discouraged although there are bridleways.There are adders on the common and as they are more likely to bite dogs than humans,anyone who is bitten must go to the vet to obtain serum!Conservation was the aim of the park but recreation is now important.
